Extracted translation from the rulebook

Name: Zombicide (2nd Edition): Gabriel
Description:
This is a promotional survivor figure from the Zombicide 2nd edition Kickstarter

A man of action, Gabriel grew from a rank-and-file policeman to a respected anti-drug cop.  Fighting zombies well before the real zombies came, he designed a very efficient intervention method to deal with drug-laced thugs in close-quarters.  A zombie tide destroyed the society he was fighting for and soon made him a legend among survivors: a wise gunslinger willing to help anyone meeting him with a good cause to fight for.

Name: La Fête des Vignerons, le jeu
Description:
In "La Fête des Vignerons, le jeu", you play as gods who control (with varying degrees of success) the weather.

Helping each one a winegrower from the region, and for the good of the grapes and the wine, you will try to manage the elements.

Your objective: to protect you from the elements by guiding them to your opponents in order to guarantee you a great wine-growing year.

The player with the most saved vineyard at the end of the game wins!

Name: Halloween Party: Memento Mori
Description:
Expansion to Hallowen Party (2019)

Halloween Party: Memento Mori includes:

-2 (3 via KS Stretch Goals) additional playable characters w/ associated reference cards (1 per character, with 1 in Spanish and 1 in English translation...6 total)
-10 Minor Spell Cards
-2 Major Spell Cards
-18 new Creature Cards (+3 additional from KS Stretch Goals)
-15 Ritual Cards
-3 Halloween Pet Cards (via KS stretch goals)
-12 reference cards (6 in Spanish, 6 in English translation)
-1 rulesheet (1 side in Spanish, 1 side in English translation)

Name: Beaver Tower
Description:
There are vigorous beavers in the mountain valley.
We need to make a cool and vertiginous tower for beavers to play at. Build a tower they want and bring as many as possible to the tower!

Use only the hands and fingers presented on the construction rule card to build the tower shown on the tower card. When you finished building the tower, you have to put the beavers on it. You will earn additional points for the number of beavers you put on your tower. After the 6th round, the player with the highest score wins.

-description from publisher

Name: Mining Colony: Objective Pack
Description:
Race to create objectives before your opponents with this 10-card pack.

—description from the designer

Name: Nanga Parbat: Hidden Objectives
Description:
Score bonus points at game end by completing secret objectives with this 7-card pack.

—description from the designer

Name: After School Adventure: The Game
Description:
After School Adventure is a go anywhere adventure game where players bypass difficult encounters and obtain wondrous treasures. ASA has 4 unique adventured players can embark on. Each adventure has its own unique challenges. The adventures include; The Old Mansion, The Spooky Forest, The carnival and The Caverns. 
Adventurers start with a specific set of skills. Skills help determine the ability of adventures to bypass encounters. Skills can be enhanced or hindered by treasure object obtain throughout each adventure. All skills accumulate from adventure to adventure. Each players skills change depending on the treasure objects found. Players can obtain special trinkets that can aid then throughout the adventures.

—description from the publisher

Name: King of Tokyo: Monster Box
Description:
The whole King of Tokyo shebang in one Monster Box.
The fight for dominating the city of Tokyo has never been so competitive! This explosive Monster Box is filled with fun and adrenaline! Get King of Tokyo and all of its indispensable Power Up! and Halloween expansions for hours and hours of smashes. Use your Monster's Evolution Cards to get even more special properties, and dress them up for even more fun! The Monster Box also comes with a brand new version of Gigazaur, exclusive cards and a new dice tray, some much needed bonuses to destroy Tokyo in style!
With the Monster Box awesome content, smash like never before!

—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Festival Guru
Description:
Festival Guru is a board game developed by festival organizers and Spieltrieb.

Players need to catch 6 live performances within 4 different stages in one festival day. We all know it's easier said than done. Pack up your festival bag and get ready for a  muddy, crazy, chilled, rowdy and epic adventure!

Get through an unpredictable action-packed festival day while you try and catch all your favorite bands live.  This game now includes 24 independent bands from across the globe that you can watch, via a QR-Code, at the end of every round.

In a festival, one prefers to be with friends when watching bands live or having drinks at the beer stands.  Hence, players get more chances to earn Fun Points when they meet friends or other rockers in the game.  As you advance across the festival ground, one should take other player's movements into account.

The one who gained the most Fun Points on the Fun Barometer, at the end of the game, is the winner.

Name: Age of Dogfights WWI: Main Expansion
Description:
This expansion for Age of Dogfights contains rules and scenarios for airships, observation ballons, barrage ballons, anti-aircraft guns and 27 new types of aircraft from 6 countries. 
With it you can find out if it isd feasible to attack with fast Italian planes on targets in the Austro-Hungarian background that is sheltered by barrage balloons and defended with strong anti-aircraft fire. Do the large and slow Russian bombers have a chance against German fighters?  What will happen when a mixed French-Serbian squadron returns from a task with low ammunition and encounters a strong Bulgarian patrol?

There are a total of 10 scenarios in the brochure enabling you to ne immersed into the role of a squadron leader on an important task.
Families: Series: Triangle System (Predrag Lazovic / Dragan Lazovic)

Name: Age of Dogfights WWI: Ottoman Empire Aircraft
Description:
Play Age of Dogfights with these 6 extra Turkish aircraft of the Ottoman Empire. 
Includes 12 aircraft tokens (2 for each aircraft), control panels, player aid and rules for 4 new scenarios using these components.
Families: Series: Triangle System (Predrag Lazovic / Dragan Lazovic)

Name: Age of Dogfights WWI: Important Aircraft Supplement
Description:
This expansion provides you with 18 important aircraft of WWI.
There are three aircraft of each type, bringing the number of aircraft tokens to 54. A player aid and control panels for all aircraft are included.
Families: Series: Triangle System (Predrag Lazovic / Dragan Lazovic)

Name: Family Feud (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
Description:
No one knows how the feud started between two of the largest families in Carcassonne. Some say it was a boundary dispute, others say it was due to a cow. No one knows for certain. But the one certain thing is that the two families will have nothing to do with each other and will go out of their way to keep their distance from each other.

New tiles with pennants of a new family.

Name: Age of Dogfights WWI: Additional Aircraft Types
Description:
This expansion provides you with 40 important aircraft of WWI.
There are two aircraft of each type, bringing the number of aircraft tokens to 80. A player aid and control panels for all aircraft are included.
Families: Series: Triangle System (Predrag Lazovic / Dragan Lazovic)

Name: Flick of Faith: Cthulhu God Promo
Description:
Cthulhu God is very powerful in the game and brings a lot of options for its owner. Maybe this mighty Great Old One doesn’t bring additional victory points to the game, but his ability opens space for many controversial moves.

Cthulhu may use other player Prophets for an additional flick after the Mission Phase ends. You may use it to flick somebody out from the map, or to move your Prophet to any Island.

—description from publisher

Name: Corfù 1716
Description:
Corfù 1716 is a wargame for two players simulating the last Venetian victory against the Ottoman Empire.

After the Morea War and the Passarowitz Peace (1699), with the Venetian reconquest of the Peloponnese area thanks to the great Doge Morosini, the Ottoman Empire seeks its revenge. 
In 1715 the Empire is ready and with the Second Peloponnesian War, it recaptures, thanks to some fortunate events and the lack of competence of the Venetian Generals, all the Aegean islands and the whole Peloponnese. 
Now the Ottoman Empire is ready to strike the Adriatic Sea, the Venetian Gulf itself. 
Only the island and fortress of Corfù is guarding it. 
It is defended by about 5000 soldiers, mostly German mercenaries, lead by Marshal Schulenberg, the Venetian Commander in Chief. 30000 ottoman soldiers tried to storm the fortress but after 20 days of heavy combats the Ottoman Army withdrew. 
It would have been the last victory of the Serenissima, as it is called Venice. Antonio Vivaldi would have composed the oratory Juditha triunphans devicta Holofernis barbarie to celebrate this great victory.

In Corfù 1716 you will find 12 Venetian combat units, divided into 6 German Mercenary units, 3 Italian infantry units and 3 Ultramarine infantry and 20 Ottoman combat units, divided into 4 Janissaries units, 9 Kapikulu infantry and 7 auxiliary Serhaddkulu units representing the regiments and units employed during the siege. 
There are two Morale chits for a total of 34 pieces, 2 d6s, a map, 9 Special Event Cards and the rules.

The map represents the area where the battle took place; it is used to register the orders and the consistency of the two armies. 
The map is divided into Area, where to deploy the units and where the actions take place during the 20 turns. 
There are the Combat Tables, with the result of the Combat and the Morale Track, which registers the Morale level of the two armies and the Turn Table.

—description from the publisher
Families: History: Classical Age of the Ottoman Empire

Name: Monster Bash
Description:
Monster Bash is a light hearted card game where players try to be the first to play all their cards!

This classic monster themed game is a family friendly game that provides fun competition and simple mathematics!

Monster Bash is a simple game, the player who received the Slime Ball card is the first player and must play the Slime Ball card.

Each subsequent player, in clock-wise order, must play any number of cards equal to the next numerical value; 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, and so on. Play continues until either one player has no cards left in their hand or a player cannot play the required numerical value. You cannot play more cards then what is needed to meet the required numerical value.

-description from designer

Name: Dampflok-Spiel
Description:
Players move their steam locomotive by dice from a depot to one of the two stations, pick up a railway wagon and deliver this wagon to the other station. The railway track gives opportunities to overtake other trains or to use an abbreviation.
After this work is done, the player to arrive first at the depot wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Full pott
Description:
The cup is placed in the middle of the board (number 7) and all the markers are placed besides the board (a "bank").

When it is your turn, you roll the two dices and put one of the marker (from "the bank") in the matching circle (from 2 to 11).
If that circle is already filled, then the player empties it by taking all the markers (putting them into personal stash).

When a player hits 7, the player has to pay one "owned" marker into the cup.
When someone hits a 12, that player gets all markers in the cup.

When all the markers in "the bank" are gone, then it is all reversed: when you hit a number: remove a marker from that number (as long as there are markers left).
When you hit a 7, you have to put one of your markers in the cup.
Hit a 12, and you get all the markers in the cup.
The winner is the one with most markers, when all are gone from the board (and from the bank).

No strategy, pure luck

—user summary

Name: Middara: The Judge's Daughter Resin Kit
Description:
Lupercalia beckons.

Through decadence and debauchery these lustful figures can be called from the depths of Earth’s history. Espers made manifest only through esoteric quiet whispers shared amongst the elite.

Such coveted creatures are called upon for far more than combat. Yet, their true names and seals are clutched closely to the hearts of those who covet them most. Jealousy worms its way into the heart, and rots at the very soul of those who know these secret combinations.

Those lucky few able to overhear their betters slip such forbidden knowledge during inebriated tales of past forays find themselves more than excited to let their soul wear away at the chance to even behold such monstrosities.

The Judges Daughter
An exceptionally detailed resin model of The Judges Daughter. This Resin Kit provides options for a new Esper that can be summoned by Adventurers and Opponents as well as a new Adventurer that can be used during the Crawl Mode.

This resin kit includes a Judges’ Daughter miniature on a 50mm base, 1x Adventurer card, 2x Loyal Esper Cards, 2x Opposing Esper Cards, 4x Initiative Cards, 4x Upgrade Cards, and an Art card.

Requires assembly.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Middara: Psyche, Aphorism of Love Resin Kit
Description:
Lupercalia beckons.

Through decadence and debauchery these lustful figures can be called from the depths of Earth’s history. Espers made manifest only through esoteric quiet whispers shared amongst the elite.

Such coveted creatures are called upon for far more than combat. Yet, their true names and seals are clutched closely to the hearts of those who covet them most. Jealousy worms its way into the heart, and rots at the very soul of those who know these secret combinations.

Those lucky few able to overhear their betters slip such forbidden knowledge during inebriated tales of past forays find themselves more than excited to let their soul wear away at the chance to even behold such monstrosities.

Psyche
An exceptionally detailed resin model of Psyche. This Resin Kit provides options for a new Esper that can be summoned by Adventurers and Opponents as well as a new Adventurer that can be used during the Crawl Mode.

This resin kit includes a Psyche miniature on a 50mm base and Aphrodite on a 25mm base, 1x Adventurer card, 2x Loyal Esper Cards, 2x Opposing Esper Cards, 2x Initiative Cards, 6x Item Cards, and an Art card.

Requires assembly.

-description from publisher's website
